document_data.name: Badger
document_data.mainbody: '''Badgers''' were a squat, furry species of [[wikipedia:en:Mustilidae|mustelid]].
document_data.Description: Badgers a distinctive white stripe from the tip of its long nose to the back of its head and white cheeks. They were a burrowing creature, considered to be experts at digging.
document_data.Combat: Badgers were fierce fights and notorious for their fury when threatened. Despite its small size, when angered a badger's strong bite and sharp claws could be highly dangerous.

Sub-Species.Giant badger: a rare variety that were twice the size of the standard badger, but largely the same in appearance.

Ecology.Habitats:
In the [[Unapproachable East]], badgers could be found in the [[Tannath Gap]], [[Yuirwood]], and [[Ashenwood]].

In [[Kara-Tur]] they could be found in its temperate plains and forests, tropical forests, and steppelands.
Ecology.Relationships:
Badgers were admired by the [[gnome]] race and could often be seen serving as "watchdogs" for [[rock gnome]] homes. 

Badgers were a [[favored animal]] of the deities [[Garl Glittergold]], [[Geb]], [[Rillifane Rallathil]], [[Sheela Peryroyl]], [[Silvanus]], and [[Tempus]]. They often chose these beasts to act as symbols of their favor to their followers.{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|8,10-15}}
Ecology.Usages: Some creatures were known to hunt badgers for the pelts. These typically fetched prices of around 10 to 30 [[gold piece]]s.

document_data.Trivia:
* Some [[Ysgardian dwarves]] could assume the form of a badger.
* A badger could be summoned by the ''[[conjure animals]]'' [[spell]].<ref>
